## Conversion.StringConverter.matching() method

Returns a [StringConverter](./ts-utils.conversion.stringconverter.md) which constrains the result to match a supplied regular expression.

**Signature:**

```typescript
matching(match: RegExp, options?: Partial<StringMatchOptions>): StringConverter<T, TC>;
```

</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

match


</td><td>

RegExp


</td><td>

The regular expression to be used as a constraint.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

options


</td><td>

Partial&lt;[StringMatchOptions](./ts-utils.conversion.stringmatchoptions.md)<!-- -->&gt;


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ Optional [Conversion.StringMatchOptions](./ts-utils.conversion.stringmatchoptions.md) for this conversion


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

[StringConverter](./ts-utils.stringconverter.md)<!-- -->&lt;T, TC&gt;

[Success](./ts-utils.success.md) with a matching string or [Failure](./ts-utils.failure.md) with an informative error if the string does not match.
